snippet: Self-publishing is expanding beyond first-time writers who can’t get deals, as big names like the playwright and author David Mamet are choosing this route, another sign that digital disruption is reshaping the publishing market.
abstract: Self-publishing is expanding beyond first-time writers who cannot get deals, as big names like playwright and author David Mamet are choosing this route; as digital disruption continues to reshape market, it is becoming more popular, and more feasible, with increasing array of options.
